meanings.definition: In a way that shows great hunger or greed
meanings.sent1: The child ate ravenously after playing outside all day.
meanings.sent2: The wolf looked around ravenously for its next meal.
meanings.sent3: The cookies disappeared ravenously from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The treasure hunters searched ravenously for the hidden chest.
meanings.sent5: The flames of hunger burned ravenously in his stomach.

meanings.definition: In a way that shows intense desire or enthusiasm
meanings.sent1: She listened ravenously to the exciting story.
meanings.sent2: The fans cheered ravenously for their favorite team.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail ravenously at the sight of its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted ravenously, lost in the colors of the canvas.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes sparkled ravenously with anticipation for the surprise.
